text: Computational biology is a field of active research that studies problems in biology that need algorithms or statistics.NIH working definition of bioinformatics and computational biology". Biomedical Information Science and Technology Initiative. 17 July 2000. Retrieved 18 August 2012. Center for Computational Molecular Biology. Retrieved 18 August 2012. Many people who work in computational biology are trained in biology, biophysics, bioinformatics, engineering, physics, statistics, or chemistry. == References == Category:Branches of biology Category:Computing
title: Computational biology
